tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE FanPreferences (
    fan_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    fan_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    favorite_genre VARCHAR(50),
    preferred_content VARCHAR(100),
    behavior_score FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE fans (fan_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  fan_name VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(100),
  preferences TEXT,
  tracking_behavior TEXT);

CREATE TABLE ar_experiences (experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  experience_name VARCHAR(50),
  fan_id INT,
  experience_details TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (fan_id) REFERENCES fans(fan_id));

CREATE TABLE behavior (
    behavior_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    behavior_type VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ar_experiences (
    experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    experience_name VARCHAR(100),
    experience_details JSON,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE fans (
    fan_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    fan_name VARCHAR(255),
    fan_email VARCHAR(255),
    fan_age INT,
    fan_location VARCHAR(255),
    fan_preferences TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE behaviors (
    behavior_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    fan_id INT,
    behavior_type VARCHAR(255),
    behavior_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    behavior_data JSON
)

CREATE TABLE ar_experiences (
    experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    fan_id INT,
    experience_name VARCHAR(255),
    experience_description TEXT,
    experience_date DATE,
    experience_rating FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE preferences (
    preference_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    fan_id INT,
    preference_category VARCHAR(255),
    preference_value TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE Fans (
  fan_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  fan_name VARCHAR(50),
  fan_email VARCHAR(100),
  fan_phone VARCHAR(20),
  fan_birthdate DATE
)

CREATE TABLE Preferences (
  preference_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  fan_id INT,
  preference_name VARCHAR(50),
  preference_category VARCHAR(50),
  FOREIGN KEY (fan_id) REFERENCES Fans(fan_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Behaviors (
  behavior_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  fan_id INT,
  behavior_type VARCHAR(50),
  behavior_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (fan_id) REFERENCES Fans(fan_id)
)

CREATE TABLE ARExperiences (
  experience_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  experience_name VARCHAR(50),
  experience_type VARCHAR(50),
  experience_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE FanARPreferences (
  fan_id INT,
  experience_id INT,
  last_modified TIMESTAMP,
  PRIMARY KEY (fan_id, experience_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (fan_id) REFERENCES Fans(fan_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (experience_id) REFERENCES ARExperiences(experience_id)
)
